intro: Appendicula ovalis, commonly known as the oval appendicula, is a small flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid conditions. It produces tiny, inconspicuous fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
